    <item>
      <title>New Attack Reported by Swift Global Bank Network</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/swift-global-bank-network-attack.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/swift-global-bank-network-attack.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/swift-global-bank-network-attack.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13DB-SWIFT/13DB-SWIFT-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Atiur Rahman, a former Bangladesh Bank governor, in March. Details about a second attack involving the messaging system, Swift, are emerging as investigators try to solve an $81 million heist from the central bank of Bangladesh in February.</media:description>
      <media:credit>A.M. Ahad/The Associated Press</media:credit>
      <description>Investigators are still trying to solve the $81 million heist from the central bank of Bangladesh in February.</description>
      <dc:creator>MICHAEL CORKERY</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:30:52 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Computer Security</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Robberies and Thefts</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Apple Puts $1 Billion in Didi, a Rival to Uber in China</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>The investment gives the tech giant a big stake in the top ride-hailing service in China, where the iPhone maker has otherwise struggled.</description>
      <dc:creator>MIKE ISAAC and VINDU GOEL</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:07:41 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Apple Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_geo">China</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Didi Chuxing</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Minnesota Law School, Facing Waning Interest, Cuts Admissions</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/minnesota-law-school-facing-waning-interest-cuts-admissions.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/minnesota-law-school-facing-waning-interest-cuts-admissions.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/minnesota-law-school-facing-waning-interest-cuts-admissions.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13MINNESOTALAW-1/13MINNESOTALAW-1-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>David Wippman, the dean of the University of Minnesota Law School, said raising tuition was not an option for combating a decline in applications.</media:description>
      <media:credit>David Bowman for The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>By shrinking enrollment, and taking in less tuition income, the University of Minnesota hopes to preserve its national standing as a top law school.</description>
      <dc:creator>ELIZABETH OLSON</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:58:56 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Admissions Standards</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Law Schools</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Legal Profession</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">University of Minnesota</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Law School Admissions Council</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Donald Trump’s Chief Fund-Raiser Heads Straight for Las Vegas</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/donald-trumps-chief-fund-raiser-heads-straight-for-las-vegas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/donald-trumps-chief-fund-raiser-heads-straight-for-las-vegas.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/donald-trumps-chief-fund-raiser-heads-straight-for-las-vegas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13DB-MNUCHIN/13DB-MNUCHIN-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>On Wednesday, Steven Mnuchin, Donald Trump’s campaign fund-raiser, met with hedge fund managers in Las Vegas.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Andrew H. Walker/Getty Images</media:credit>
      <description>Steven Mnuchin, a hedge fund veteran himself, starts calling on big-money donors at a hedge fund conference gilded with Trump supporters.</description>
      <dc:creator>ALEXANDRA STEVENSON</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:45:15 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Mnuchin, Steven T</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Trump, Donald J</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Campaign Finance</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">United States Politics and Government</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Donald Trump Won’t Alter Tax Plan, Spokeswoman Says as Confusion Reigns</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/donald-trump-wont-alter-tax-plan-spokeswoman-says-as-confusion-reigns.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/donald-trump-wont-alter-tax-plan-spokeswoman-says-as-confusion-reigns.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/donald-trump-wont-alter-tax-plan-spokeswoman-says-as-confusion-reigns.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/us/13trumptax/13trumptax-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Donald J. Trump at a campaign rally in West Virginia last week. He had hinted at changing his tax plan to cut its cost and make it less generous to the rich.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Ty Wright for The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>The comments were meant to clarify the matter after advisers and the candidate himself hinted that the plan might change to reduce its cost and make it less generous to the rich.</description>
      <dc:creator>JACKIE CALMES</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:05:59 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Presidential Election of 2016</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Trump, Donald J</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Taxation</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Federal Taxes (US)</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Kudlow, Lawrence A</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">CNBC</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Tax Foundation</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Tax Policy Center</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Facebook, Facing Bias Claims, Shows How Editors and Algorithms Guide News</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13FACEBOOK/13FACEBOOK-moth-v2.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Mark Zuckerberg, the chief of Facebook, which detailed how both editors and computer algorithms play roles in the process of picking what appears in the “Trending Topics” section of Facebook pages.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Chandan Khanna/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images</media:credit>
      <description>Accused of political bias, the company offered details on how human editors and algorithms choose what appears — or doesn’t appear — in “Trending Topics.”</description>
      <dc:creator>MIKE ISAAC</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:34:11 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Facebook Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Social Media</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">News and News Media</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Antitrust in the Age of Amazon</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/office-depot-staples-merger-antitrust-amazon.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/office-depot-staples-merger-antitrust-amazon.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/office-depot-staples-merger-antitrust-amazon.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13retail-web1/13retail-web1-moth-v3.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Big companies shop for products like toner cartridges differently than individuals do – and that’s a reason why the Federal Trade Commission blocked the Office Depot-Staples merger.</media:description>
      <media:credit>James Nieves/The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>Pens matter. Ink does not. The blocking of the Staples-Office Depot union illustrates the complications the age of Amazon has created in the retail industry.</description>
      <dc:creator>RACHEL ABRAMS</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:27:03 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Office Supplies and Equipment</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Antitrust Laws and Competition Issues</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Federal Trade Commission</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Office Depot Inc.</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Staples Inc</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Nissan Throws a Lifeline to Scandal-Stricken Mitsubishi</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/stricken-by-fuel-economy-scandal-mitsubishi-turns-to-nissan.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/stricken-by-fuel-economy-scandal-mitsubishi-turns-to-nissan.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/dealbook/stricken-by-fuel-economy-scandal-mitsubishi-turns-to-nissan.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13db-nissan/13db-nissan-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Carlos Ghosn, left, chairman of Nissan, with Mitsubishi’s chairman, Osamu Masuko, at a news conference Thursday in Yokohama, Japan.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Franck Robichon/European Pressphoto Agency</media:credit>
      <description>Nissan will buy a 34 percent stake in the automaker for $2.2 billion, which could help Mitsubishi cope with the impact of cheating on mileage tests.</description>
      <dc:creator>JONATHAN SOBLE</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:11:36 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Automobiles</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Mitsubishi Motor Corp</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Nissan Motor Co</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Fuel Efficiency</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>E.P.A. Methane Leak Rules Take Aim at Climate Change</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/obama-methane-epa.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/obama-methane-epa.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/obama-methane-epa.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/us/13methane-web/13methane-web-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>A pump jack near Ardmore, Okla. New regulations seek to control emissions of methane gas that could leak from new oil and gas wells.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Brandon Thibodeaux for The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>The regulations require oil and gas companies to plug and capture leaks of methane from new and modified drilling wells and storage tanks.</description>
      <dc:creator>CORAL DAVENPORT</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:44:55 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Methane</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Global Warming</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Greenhouse Gas Emissions</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Environmental Protection Agency</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Obama, Barack</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Judge Backs House Challenge to a Key Part of Health Law</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/health-law-obama.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/health-law-obama.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/us/politics/health-law-obama.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/us/13health-web/13house-web-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>John A. Boehner, then speaker of the House, reflected in a cabinet filled with Republican memorabilia on Capitol Hill last year. He initiated the lawsuit as a way to push back against the White House on the health care law.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Doug Mills/The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>A federal judge ruled that Congress never provided explicit authority for a program to help lower-income people pay expenses, but suspended the ruling pending an appeal.</description>
      <dc:creator>CARL HULSE</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:23:08 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Suits and Litigation (Civil)</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">House of Representatives</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Obama, Barack</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">United States Politics and Government</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Boehner, John A</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Law and Legislation</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Collyer, Rosemary M</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_geo">Washington (DC)</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Subaru Recalls More Than 48,000 Vehicles for Steering Problems</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/subaru-recalls-more-than-48000-vehicles-for-steering-problems.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/subaru-recalls-more-than-48000-vehicles-for-steering-problems.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/subaru-recalls-more-than-48000-vehicles-for-steering-problems.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>The automaker warned owners not to drive the certain models until they were inspected or repaired.</description>
      <dc:creator>CHRISTOPHER JENSEN</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:38:59 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Automobiles</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Recalls and Bans of Products</category>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Subaru</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Shell Says Thousands of Gallons of Oil Have Leaked Into Gulf of Mexico</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/energy-environment/shell-says-thousands-of-gallons-of-oil-have-leaked-into-gulf-of-mexico.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>

      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/energy-environment/shell-says-thousands-of-gallons-of-oil-have-leaked-into-gulf-of-mexico.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>The Coast Guard said the leak had been secured, and officials were investigating the cause.</description>

    <item>
      <title>Market Is Mixed After Unemployment Claims Rise</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/daily-stock-market-activity.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/daily-stock-market-activity.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/business/daily-stock-market-activity.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>Technology and health care stocks took the largest losses. Retailers received more bad news as Kohl’s reported disappointing first-quarter results.</description>

    <item>
      <title>Brooklyn Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>Prosecutors wanted to keep Facebook from telling users about 15 subpoenas of their data. But a judge refused, saying the need for them was not specific enough.</description>
      <dc:creator>ALAN FEUER</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:58:20 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Facebook Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Subpoenas</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Privacy</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_geo">Brooklyn (NYC)</category>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Electronic Communications Privacy Act</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Microsoft Corp</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Charter Communications-Time Warner Cable Deal Clears Final Hurdle</title>

    <item>
      <title>An Ayn Rand Acolyte Selling Students a Self-Made Dream</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/business/an-ayn-rand-acolyte-selling-students-a-self-made-dream.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/business/an-ayn-rand-acolyte-selling-students-a-self-made-dream.html</guid>

      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/08/business/08BARNEY/08BARNEY-moth-v2.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Carl Barney on the slopes in Utah. He credits his rise from the deprivations of postwar London to the top of a for-profit college company partly to the ideas of Ayn Rand, a champion of heroic individualism.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Kim Raff for The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>Carl Barney made millions running for-profit colleges, but he says it’s Rand’s unapologetic vision of unfettered capitalism that has put him on top.</description>
      <dc:creator>PATRICIA COHEN</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 12:05:35 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Barney, Carl B (1941- )</category>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Colleges and Universities</category>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_per">Rand, Ayn</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Podcasts Surge, but Producers Fear Apple Isn’t Listening</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/business/media/podcasts-surge-apple.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/business/media/podcasts-surge-apple.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/08/business/media/podcasts-surge-apple.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/08/business/08PODCASTS/08PODCASTS-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Chris Morrow, chief executive of the Loud Speakers Podcast Network, said, “I think everyone who’s seriously involved in this space, they’d at least like to know what the endgame is.”</media:description>
      <media:credit>Alex Welsh for The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>The podcast has soared in popularity. But there’s not much money in it for Apple, the genre’s creator, leaving many in the community feeling neglected.</description>
      <dc:creator>JOHN HERRMAN</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 13:54:22 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Podcasts</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Apple Inc</category>

    </item>
